articles.description: At the start of 2020, the Kremlin leader seemed to be coasting toward a presidency-for-life. What followed instead was an annus horribilis for Russia, and perhaps Putin's most challenging year to date.

articles.author: Francesca Giuliani-Hoffman, CNN
articles.title: Scientists discover a new species of snake hiding in plain sight
articles.description: The newly identified Levitonius mirus, also known as Waray Dwarf Burrowing Snake, is native to the islands of Samar and Leyte in the Philippines, an exceptionally biodiverse archipelago that includes at least 112 land snake species.

articles.author: Alaa Elassar, CNN
articles.title: Beyoncé to donate $500,000 to people impacted by the eviction crisis
articles.description: Beyoncé will offer $5,000 grants to help people facing foreclosures or evictions due to the housing crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.author: Alaa Elassar, CNN
articles.title: A preschool teacher who was laid off after 20 years won a $250,000 lottery
articles.description: After working as a preschool teacher in Charlotte, North Carolina, for two decades, Joe Camp was laid off in September amid the coronavirus pandemic. A month later, he lost his father.
articles.content:
Want more inspiring, positive news? Sign up for The Good Stuff, a newsletter for the good in life. It will brighten your inbox every Saturday morning.

articles.author: Travis Caldwell, Eric Levenson and Artemis Moshtaghian, CNN
articles.title: These six Nashville police officers evacuated residents moments before motor home exploded
articles.description: Six Nashville police officers are credited for evacuating residents away from a nearby recreational vehicle parked in downtown Nashville Friday morning, authorities said. The RV later exploded, injuring three and damaging dozens of buildings.

articles.author: Analysis by Kevin Liptak, CNN
articles.title: Trump's mind is elsewhere as unemployment benefits run out for millions of Americans
articles.description: A day before unemployment benefits for millions of Americans were set to expire, President Donald Trump had a different insult in mind: his former-model wife has yet to appear on the cover of a fashion magazine as first lady.

articles.author: By Nectar Gan and Brett McKeehan, CNN
articles.title: First case of coronavirus variant detected in France
articles.description: The coronavirus pandemic has brought countries to a standstill. Meanwhile, vaccinations have already started in some countries as cases continue to rise. Follow here for the latest.
articles.content:
A Boston health care worker with a history of allergies developed an allergic reaction after receiving a Moderna Covid-19 vaccine on Christmas Eve.

articles.title: CDC to require negative Covid-19 test for all passengers traveling to US from UK

articles.author: Elizabeth Cohen and Michael Nedelman, CNN
articles.title: CDC rule for UK travelers is like 'a chain link fence to keep out a mosquito,' experts say
articles.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has announced new testing requirements for travelers arriving from the UK, but research by the agency's own scientists shows the rule may have only a small impact on the spread of the new UK strain of coronavi…

articles.author: Opinion by Karl A. Racine and Miriam Aroni Krinsky
articles.title: How Joe Biden can root out racism in criminal justice
articles.description: The night of his victory, President-elect Joe Biden declared that the American people had given him a mandate to "marshal the forces of decency...fairness... science and... hope in the great battles of our time" -- among them, the battle for racial justice.

articles.title: Duke women's basketball cancels rest of 2020-2021 season because of Covid-19 concerns
articles.description: Duke University's women's basketball team will not play the remainder of the 2020-2021 season, citing health and safety concerns stemming from Covid-19, the school announced Friday.

articles.title: China turns off the lights in 'Christmas town' as officials race to meet energy targets
